questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains the groups shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You plan to create 10 new users and configure group-based licensing to assign each user a Microsoft 365 E5 license.

To which group should you add the users, and which portal should you use to assign the license? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

comments.content: I tried in my tenant lab and I could link licences to group 1 and group 2... and did it in admin center... Once it doesn´t have group1 & group2 option, I´d chose security group (group 1).

discussion.content:
Group: Group 1-Security Group

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/users/licensing-admin-center
"This article shows you how to use the Microsoft 365 license center to assign licenses to Security groups."

Portal: M365 Admin Center
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/users/licensing-admin-center
"Sign in to the Microsoft 365 admin center as at least a License Administrator."

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/users/licensing-groups-assign
"Starting September 1st, the Microsoft Entra ID Admin Center and the Microsoft Azure portal will no longer support license assignment through their user interfaces. To manage license assignments for users and groups, administrators must use the Microsoft 365 Admin Center"

comments.content:
I looked deeper into this topic.
Microsoft states: "We review our cloud-based exams quarterly. Any changes that affect the objective domain and the existing questions are incorporated into the exam. Specifically, technically inaccurate questions are removed from the exam; some items are modified, and new items may be created to assess new, but related, skills."
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/frequently-asked-questions?source=recommendations#what-is-the-process-for-determining-if-an-exam-has-been-updated-when-a-new-feature-or-function-is-added-or-when-something-has-changed-in-the-associated-technology-
This exam was updated in July (Q3). The feature was updated in September (Q3). It is now November (Q4). Meaning, the correct answer should be Portal: M365 Admin Center.
I am going to answer M365 Admin Center and add a comment. I remember other Microsoft exams where they still asked outdated features years after the fact.

I disagree with your second option - even thought it is correct now.
Group: Security Group (you don't need email and other stuff included in an M365 group)
Portal: Since September it is indeed M365 Admin Center but this exam was updated in July. And it was still Entra then.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/users/licensing-groups-assign
I prefer security group, but both seem to work. The Microsoft 365 group needs to be "private" and "role" assignment.

discussion.content:
Group 1 - Security Group
Portal: The Microsoft 365 admin center

They have moved the license group from Entra to 365 admin center. 
Adding, removing, and reprocessing licensing assignments is only available within the M365 Admin Center.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a Windows 11 device named Device1.
Device1 is onboarded to Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

You need to ensure that Device1 is blocked from connecting to IP address 131.107.10.15.

What should you configure in the Microsoft Defender Endpoint settings? To answer, select the appropriate settings in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
I agree!
Advanced Features: Custom network indicators
Rules: Indicators

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-endpoint/indicator-ip-domain

Looks right to me:
Advanced Features: Custom network indicators
Rules: Indicators

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains the users shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You configure a Multifactor authentication registration policy that has the following settings:

• Assignments:
o Include: Group1
o Exclude: Group2
• Controls: Require Microsoft Entra ID multifactor authentication registration
• Policy enforcement: Enabled

You create a conditional access policy that has the following settings:

• Name: Policy1
• Assignments:
o Include: Group2
o Exclude: Group1
• Grant: Require multifactor authentication
• Enable policy: On

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
This question is identical to question 247
No: He gets a registration prompt next time. BUT he can postpone registration
No: He is excluded from both policies (exclude overrules include)
Yes: He is included in the Conditional Access Policy

comments.content:
Sorry there is a difference
Required to REGISTER
vs
Required to USE

discussion.content:
Let me know if I'm wrong!

Who manage the required registration of the MFA is the "Multifactor authentication registration policy". The "conditional access policy" will only allow the access or not if you have this requeriment, but it will not require the MFA registration.

N-N-N

User 1 is in scope for requiring registration, but is not required for MFA yet, so user can bypass:
User 2 is already enabled.
User 3 is in group 2, excluded for the MFA registration.

comments.content: the question is "will be required to REGISTER for MFA on the next sign-in" so User 3 Excluded by Group2 → Not required to register for MFA.

Actually , N-N-Y .

User 3 is in scope and "required for MFA"

discussion.content:
N-N-N

User 1 is in scope for requiring registration, but is not required for MFA so user can bypass:
Microsoft Entra ID Protection will prompt your users to register the next time they sign in interactively and they'll have 14 days to complete registration. During this 14-day period, they can bypass registration if MFA isn't required as a condition, but at the end of the period they're required to register before they can complete the sign-in process.

User 2 is already enrolled.

User 3 is out of scope of policies.

comments.content:
Yes: MFA Policy.
No: MFA is already enabled.
Yes: CA policy.

First one is No, User1 is excluded from CA policy, and only included in MFA registration policy which will not enforce user to register MFA on the next sign-in, registration can be skipped for 14 days.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/id-protection/howto-identity-protection-configure-mfa-policy#user-experience

discussion.content:
Y-N-Y

User 3 : => Group 2 is excluded of Assignments
But the Policy 1 require MFA, so the next time, User 3 will be required to register

comments.content: The key in this question is the "raw" ip address... is the real ip address not the nat ip address. So YNN is correct.

discussion.content:
N-Y-N
Montreal is a "maybe" because of the subnet mask mismatch in the config.

Policy matches Seattle IP. 1 download per second for 2 mins surpasses the 30 threshold in the policy for 1 min. 

NY doesn't match policy anywhere.
Maybe a typo in the "Activities". If user comes from 10.10.0.X --> YES, If from 10.10.1_255.X --> NO
Check the Montreal ip address subnet mask vs the given ip address in Activities matching... I think it is NO

Selected Answer: C
it is C.
3 - More aggressive: Messages that are identified as phishing with a medium or high degree of confidence are treated as if they were identified with a very high degree of confidence.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-office-365/anti-phishing-policies-about#advanced-phishing-thresholds-in-anti-phishing-policies-in-microsoft-defender-for-office-365

comments.content: Given that the anti-phishing policy "Policy1" is configured with a "More Aggressive" phishing email threshold (level 3), it is likely to flag emails with a medium, high, or very high phishing confidence level (PCL) as phishing emails. Therefore, Mail2 (Medium), Mail3 (High), and Mail4 (Very High) would be identified as phishing emails under this policy.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A threshold of 3 - More Aggressive means that emails with a Phishing Confidence Level (PCL) of High or Very High will be flagged as phishing.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a user named User1.

You create an anti-phishing policy named Policy1 that has the following settings:

• Include these users, groups and domains: User1
• Phishing email threshold: 3 - More Aggressive

User1 receives the email messages shown in the following table.

//IMG//


Which messages are phishing email?
